page.title: 10ARTS AND CRAFTS BRAE
page.content: SHETLAND KNITTING Knitting is not just a hobby in Shetland it is also big business.In our block there are two knitwear shops,Shaela knitwear and Nordknit.The bulk of the knitting is done by local women in their own homes.The patterned work they do is known as fair isle.The patterns used are very traditional,large patterns are from Norway and the smaller patterns are from Shetland.Jumpers can have patterns in a yoke around the neck or all over.Scarves,hats and gloves are also made. Machine made garments are less expensive than hand made articles. Some women work on industrial machines,others on new punch card machines.The women sell the jumpers to the shops,who in turn sell them to tourists or to outletson the mainland.
